road-kilometerage-central-class-a.Note: “A” Class – All roads within the network of Trunk Roads connecting the national capital with the provincial capitals and also connecting these capitals with one another. Also included are other major roads (all roads paved and bitumen surfaced with carriage way between 24ft. to 36ft. and platform width 36ft. to 56ft.).

road-kilometerage-central-class-b.Note: “B” Class – Main roads connecting other important towns and also providing important links within the trunk route system (Metalled and bitumen with a small percentage gravelled).

road-kilometerage-batticaloa-class-a.Note: “A” Class – All roads within the network of Trunk Roads connecting the national capital with the provincial capitals and also connecting these capitals with one another. Also included are other major roads (all roads paved and bitumen surfaced with carriage way between 24ft. to 36ft. and platform width 36ft. to 56ft.).

road-kilometerage-batticaloa-class-b.Note: “B” Class – Main roads connecting other important towns and also providing important links within the trunk route system (Metalled and bitumen with a small percentage gravelled).

road-kilometerage-batticaloa-class-c.Note: “C” Class – Other roads such as agricultural roads and local roads (Single carriage way of 12ft. width and a platform width of 22ft. mostly metalled but with a small percentage gravelled).

road-kilometerage-batticaloa-class-d.Note: “D” Class – Gravelled road with 8ft. – 10ft. width surface generally motorable during dry weather only.

road-kilometerage-ampara-class-a.Note: “A” Class – All roads within the network of Trunk Roads connecting the national capital with the provincial capitals and also connecting these capitals with one another. Also included are other major roads (all roads paved and bitumen surfaced with carriage way between 24ft. to 36ft. and platform width 36ft. to 56ft.).

road-kilometerage-ampara-class-b.Note: “B” Class – Main roads connecting other important towns and also providing important links within the trunk route system (Metalled and bitumen with a small percentage gravelled).

road-kilometerage-ampara-class-c.Note: “C” Class – Other roads such as agricultural roads and local roads (Single carriage way of 12ft. width and a platform width of 22ft. mostly metalled but with a small percentage gravelled).

road-kilometerage-ampara-class-d.Note: “D” Class – Gravelled road with 8ft. – 10ft. width surface generally motorable during dry weather only.

Also included are other major roads (all roads paved and bitumen surfaced with carriage way between 24ft. to 36ft. and platform width 36ft. to 56ft.).

road-kilometerage-anuradhapura-class-b.Note: “B” Class – Main roads connecting other important towns and also providing important links within the trunk route system (Metalled and bitumen with a small percentage gravelled).

road-kilometerage-anuradhapura-class-c.Note: “C” Class – Other roads such as agricultural roads and local roads (Single carriage way of 12ft. width and a platform width of 22ft. mostly metalled but with a small percentage gravelled).

road-kilometerage-anuradhapura-class-d.Note: “D” Class – Gravelled road with 8ft. – 10ft. width surface generally motorable during dry weather only.

Also included are other major roads (all roads paved and bitumen surfaced with carriage way between 24ft. to 36ft. and platform width 36ft. to 56ft.).

road-kilometerage-batticaloa-class-e.Note: “E” Class – Briddle paths, generally unmotorable but some are jeepable.

road-kilometerage-ampara-class-e.Note: “E” Class – Briddle paths, generally unmotorable but some are jeepable.

road-kilometerage-anuradhapura-class-e.Note: “E” Class – Briddle paths, generally unmotorable but some are jeepable.

road-kilometerage-badulla-class-e.Note: “E” Class – Briddle paths, generally unmotorable but some are jeepable.
